lines.text: My father didn't keep me out of Vietnam so that I could die in my own high school!

[holding a knife]
One more move and she gets a hole where she doesn't need one.
I know Walter Baylor intimately.
Really? Well, did you know he was going to kill Milt?
Yes.
Then why didn't you try to stop him?
I couldn't find a parking spot.
Walter, if you come on down I promise if we're ever in the shower together again I won't snap your nuts with my towel.
Let me handle this. Hey, Walter, listen, you're making a big deal out of nothing. You're not unique, you know. Everyone in class had sex with your sister.
He was institutionalized shortly after graduating from here. He committed a heinous crime against his parents with an upright vacuum cleaner.
[while hiding in a cupboard]
Whoever has his hand where his hand shouldn't be please remove it... Hubert.
Hey, Bunny, it's not my hand!
You know, you should consider going into public relations, Delores. You would be marvellous!
Why? So I could be some tight-assed phoney bitch like you?
Right.
You know, I like it! Hey, let's have lunch!
Good!
Erm, Meredith would you, er, I mean could you?
Gary, are you asking me to marry you?
Yeah!
Oh, yes, I'd love to be Mrs Gary, erm...?
Nash! Gary Nash!
Hey, erm, Iris? Howdya like to marry me, huh?
Oh Hubert! You mean it?
Sure. We'll settle down, have a couple of kids.
Yeah, one like you and one like me!
Perfect!
Listen! How about we all sing the Borden Loyalty Song, huh?
No! I didn't sing that fucking song in school, and I ain't singing it for you, fuzz-nuts!

[Walter is threatening to stab Meredith]
Walter, can we see her naked before you kill her?
[last lines]
Walter! Hey, it's Walter! as Walter hops in wearing a straightjacket]
Hee-hee! What a great bunch of kids!

[emergency vehicle sirens in the background]
Walter? I think your ride is here! Hey everybody, let's do the Walter!

[Looking down at Hubert's body]
Poor ignorant bastard.
Should I cremate him?
No! What happened to him?
Seems as though Walter Baylor has struck again.
Well... at least he died in the Girl's Convenience and not on a battlefield somewhere.
What Carl Jung was trying to say is that trapped inside of each of us, there is a woman that comes out when we fuck up real bad.
You mean, there's a woman trapped inside of me?
Yeah.
A black woman or a white woman?
A Jewish woman.
[Both laughing]
I don't... I don't... I don't... I don't know.
You mean, when I fuck up as a man, the woman inside comes out?
Yeah. Yeah well look, now do you understand what l'm talking about?
No. Man, have you ever thought of me as a woman?
No, but I have thought of you as a farm animal.

Bless me, father, for I have sinned. It's been one year since my last confession. Father, I have on occasion used foul language. I have lied, not just little white lies, but great, big, sinful ones. I shoplift all the time, Father.
Darling!

I'm an exhibitionist, Father. I like to expose myself to strangers, especially authority figures. I hold the neighborhood record for most repairmen satisfied in a single afternoon. I have an enormous collection of vibrators, Father. I have them in all assorted sizes. I have one that's in the shape of a crucifix. My God it's gorgeous. Oh my God, I put it up and put pictures up on the wall of all kinds of things. I listen to Barry Manilow, and over and over and over again, I think of priests and nuns, and that movie the Exorcist, how did it go, rrraaahhheeerrr?
Argumentative ninnies!
